eneter.messaging.messagingsystems.messagingsystembase
Interface IDuplexInputChannel

public interface IDuplexInputChannel

Declares the duplex input channel that can receive messages from the duplex output channel and send back response messages. Notice, the duplex input channel works only with duplex output channel and not with output channel.

Method Summary
 void disconnectResponseReceiver(java.lang.String responseReceiverId)
          Disconnects the response receiver.
 java.lang.String getChannelId()
          Returns id of this duplex input channel.
 java.lang.Boolean isListening()
          Returns true if the duplex input channel is listening.
 Event<DuplexChannelMessageEventArgs> messageReceived()
          The event is invoked when a message was received.
 Event<ResponseReceiverEventArgs> responseReceiverConnected()
          The event is invoked when a duplex output channel opened the connection.
 Event<ResponseReceiverEventArgs> responseReceiverDisconnected()
          The event is invoked when a duplex output channel closed the connection.
 void sendResponseMessage(java.lang.String responseReceiverId, java.lang.Object message)
          Sends the response message back to the connected IDuplexOutputChannel.
 void startListening()
          Starts listening to messages.
 void stopListening()
          Stops listening to messages.
 

Method Detail

messageReceived

Event<DuplexChannelMessageEventArgs> messageReceived()
The event is invoked when a message was received.

responseReceiverConnected

Event<ResponseReceiverEventArgs> responseReceiverConnected()
The event is invoked when a duplex output channel opened the connection.

responseReceiverDisconnected

Event<ResponseReceiverEventArgs> responseReceiverDisconnected()
The event is invoked when a duplex output channel closed the connection.

getChannelId

java.lang.String getChannelId()
Returns id of this duplex input channel. The id represents the 'address' the duplex input channel is listening to.

startListening

void startListening()
Starts listening to messages.

stopListening

void stopListening()
Stops listening to messages.

isListening

java.lang.Boolean isListening()
Returns true if the duplex input channel is listening.

sendResponseMessage

void sendResponseMessage(java.lang.String responseReceiverId,
                         java.lang.Object message)
Sends the response message back to the connected IDuplexOutputChannel.

Parameters:
responseReceiverId - Identifies the response receiver. The identifier comes with received messages.
message - response message

disconnectResponseReceiver

void disconnectResponseReceiver(java.lang.String responseReceiverId)
Disconnects the response receiver.

Parameters:
responseReceiverId - response receiver to be disconnected.
